rows.description: Spider mites are nearly too tiny to see with the naked eye but they cause yellow dots on leaves, and in a severe infestation leaves may lose their green colour. This image is highly magnified because you would not see this, you'll see the dots.
rows.title: Spider mites

rows.description: Thrips can cause wilting and distort leaves and fruits.
rows.title: Thrips

rows.description: Whiteflies also transmit many serious viral diseases in tomatoes, including all those on the right.
rows.title: Whiteflies

rows.description: Aphids can cause rolling, twisting, or bending of leaves, and in a heavy infestation leaves can turn yellow and wilt.
rows.title: Aphids

rows.description: Mealybugs damage plants by sucking sap from leaves, roots, and leaves. They excrete honeydew on which sooty mould develops. Ants feed on the honeydew, protecting mealy bugs from natural enemies.
rows.title: Mealy bugs

rows.description: Leafminers feed within leaves, producing large patches or winding tunnels of dead tissue.
rows.title: Leafminers

rows.description: Both the larva and adult ladybugs eat aphids and other small soft bodied insects.
rows.title: Ladybugs

rows.description: Adult hover flies can hover in the air like sunbirds or helicopters. They feed on pollen and nectar and their young are key predators of small soft bodied insects.
rows.title: Syrphid files (hover files)

rows.description: Young praying mantis are smaller with no wings but otherwise identical. They eat any insect, even others of their kind.
rows.title: Praying mantis

rows.description: Adult dragonflies eat insects of all types. They are among the most successful predators and catch over 90% of the prey they target (lions are successful less than 20% of time).
rows.title: Dragonflies

rows.description: Wasps eat other insects such as aphids, caterpillars, and flies.
rows.title: Wasps

rows.description: Ants are natural predators of many insect pests including caterpillars, termites and, fly and flea larvae. However, they can increase the abundance of honeydew-producing pests like mealy bugs.
rows.title: Ants

rows.description: Spiders can eat up to 880 million tons of insects each year.
rows.title: Spiders

rows.description: Food crops that have flowers can attract many beneficial insects.
rows.title: Food crops with flowers

rows.description: Use pesticidal plants like tephrosia or tithonia if pest populations start getting out of control.
rows.title: Pesticidal plants

rows.description: Plant flower strips on edges of veg and field crops.
rows.title: Flower strips

rows.description: Allow grasses and wildflowers to grow on the margins of your fields and gardens. Donâ€™t disturb them.
rows.title: Wildflowers

rows.description: Hedgerows, tree lines and contour lines attract beneficials provided they also include flowering plants.
rows.title: Hedgerows
